author: Jake Lahut
title: Almost half of the coronavirus cases in South Dakota are from one slaughterhouse. The governor insists the state doesn't need a stay-at-home order as cases rise.
description: With South Dakota's number of COVID-19 cases doubling every four days, Gov. Kristi Noem is still holding off on issuing a stay-at-home order. Around half of the state's cases so far have come from the Smithfield Foods processing facility in Sioux Falls. The p…
content:
South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem is still holding off on issuing a stay-at-home order amid a COVID-19 outbreak at a meat processing plant and the number of cases statewide doubling every four days.
Noem, an ally of President Donald Trump, is one of just five go… [+1628 chars]
